Description:
Luxury terrace living in an unrivalled position
Youll love:
Sitting directly behind the 1st tee of The Sands Torquay Golf Course with a view that stretches on for days this luxury terrace abode has a north-facing position that is unrivalled.
Enjoying the all-day sun on both levels, especially upstairs in the impressive kitchen & informal living/dining area that takes in the splendid view.
The fresh, modern & contemporary feel of the home with high ceilings, premium double blinds in all rooms & commercial grade heating & cooling throughout.
Spending cocktail hour on the huge undercover deck that makes the most of the sea breeze in summer & is also heated for winter!
Plus:
The kitchen is fabulous & has quality stone benchtops, a Smeg gas cooktop & oven, designer pendant lighting & a built-in fridge/freezer.
All 4 bedrooms have BIRs and are situated on the ground level including a large master with walk-through robes & a beautiful ensuite.
Theres also the stylish courtyard & tiled foyer that greets you upon entry, plus multiple storage options throughout, a remote single garage, additional parking space & much more.
Located only a few hundred metres away from Whites Beach & with the added benefit of a pool & gym membership across the road in the resort what more could you possibly want!
Insights: 5 Seaspray Place, Torquay VIC 3228 was last sold in 2020 and 139 other 4 bedroom house in Torquay have recently been sold.

Description:
Rare Land Offering in Prime Position
Ready for a new chapter this substantial plot of land sitting on approximately 674m2 is in a quiet court on the high side off Moruya Drive and will make the perfect spot for a new dream home or development site for townhouses/units (STCA).
Virtually flat with driveway access already mapped on the northern side, blocks like this built up in already established residential areas don't come along very often. Grovedale has gone from strength to strength in recent times and it's not hard to see why with close proximity to Waurn Ponds Shopping Centre, the Surf Coast and CBD.
The case for Coolalie can't be kept quiet for too long!
Insights: 13 Coolalie Court, Grovedale VIC 3216 was last sold in 2020.

Description:
SETTLE INTO YOUR NEW COMFORT ZONE
Get in the zone for contemporary living with this versatile three-bedroom home in sought-after Highton.
With two distinct zones on two levels, its ideal for a corporate couple with a home office, a family keen on a teenage retreat or for downsizers to accommodate guests or grandchildren.
Step straight into the immaculate homes upper zone headlined by a large living space, combining a central kitchen with a lounge room and separate meals area enjoying views across Highton.
That scenic outlook is also on offer from an adjoining deck ideal for alfresco entertaining.
The main floor is also home to a generous master suite with walk-in robe and ensuite, powder room, study and direct access to the double garage.
The lower zone comprises a central games room, two bedrooms with built-in robes, full-size bathroom, laundry, private garden and three storage rooms.
Other highlights include a quality kitchen with loads of storage options, pantry and breakfast bar, timber floors, ducted heating and cooling throughout, plus electric panel heaters in the bedrooms.
The property is zoned to highly regarded Belmont High School and Montpellier Primary School and is a short drive to Christian College and Clairvaux Catholic Primary School.
Its also minutes from Buckley Falls, the Barwon River and parks and sports grounds.
Cafes and shopping are nearby at Highton Village or Waurn Ponds Shopping Centre, while Deakin University and the Epworth Hospital are within easy reach.
For commuters, the M1 to Melbourne is on your doorstep.
Insights: 1/7 Leigh Road, Highton VIC 3216 was last sold in 2020 and 138 other 3 bedroom house in Highton have recently been sold.

Description:
A League Of Its Own
All inspections welcome via private viewing. Please contact agent to arrange an inspection.
This incredible Victorian-inspired home epitomises the class of the era, finished with the finest attention to detail and located in one of Highton's most sought after blue-chip locations. Boasting six large bedrooms with the masters retreat upstairs, three bathrooms and four separate living areas, this home is on a scale that is rarely seen. Meticulous inside and out, the home also showcases the very best in entertaining options with a huge outdoor alfresco, separate balcony with panoramic views and a manicured yard. If space and luxury is your priority then this home is an absolute must see.
Features include:
- Six bedrooms, three bathrooms, four living rooms
- Renovated kitchen with granite tops
- Bluechip Highton location with stunning panoramic views
- Ornate cornices, detailed plasterwork and architraves
- Hardwood Timber floors
- Finest quality Axminster carpet
- Undercover entertaining and front balcony
- Central heating & central refrigerated cooling
- Two separate open fireplaces
- Large two car garage plus separate workshop/cellar
- Large 10.7 x 4.2m under home storage
- Two hot water systems
Insights: 4 Hillary Court, Highton VIC 3216 was last sold in 2020.

Description:
Private, quiet, spacious and ready to go!
This lovely spacious home set amongst a lush garden on 653m2 is a quiet sanctuary for those who love to be home! Comprising 4 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, 2 living plus dining room and Galley kitchen. The entry of the home is down a long pathway with the 3-car carport and garden and lawn area on the northern aspect of the property. The layout has 3 of the 4 bedrooms at the front of the home. These are generous in size and all feature built in robes apart from the main which has a walk-in robe to the ensuite. A single bedroom is located near the front door. The 2 living rooms are located side by side toward the rear of the home with one being adjacent to the galley kitchen and the second next to the formal dining. The kitchen features electric cooktop and oven a dishwasher and large space for a fridge. Climate control is via wall furnaces and airconditioning. Outside are 2 garden sheds, undercover BBQ pergola, lawn and garden to the rear and fernery and water tank on the southern side of the home. With plenty of scope for updating this really is a gorgeous property, spacious, private and quiet. Close to school, bus routes and only moments away from Leopold's Gateway Plaza it is an ideal home or investment. You'll need to be quick to inspect this one!
Rental Estimate $380/week
*All information about the property has been provided to Hayeswinckle by third parties. Hayeswinckle has not verified the information and does not warrant its accuracy or completeness. Parties should make and rely on their own enquiries in relation to this property.
Insights: 52 Allanvale Ave, Leopold VIC 3224 was last sold in 2020 and 94 other 4 bedroom house in Leopold have recently been sold.

Description:
Immaculate and Low Maintenance
Boasting a pleasant street appeal and immaculate interior to follow, this 4 bedroom home, plus study is sure to impress upon inspection. The master bedroom features a WIR and ensuite , the other 3 bedrooms are also a great size with WIR, fans and are serviced by the family bathroom. The beautiful kitchen features stainless steel appliances and is adjoined to the generous 2nd living area/ dining area. Outside features a deck ideal for entertaining friends and family when they come over, the low maintenance and established gardens add to the relaxing appeal of this home. Other features include large separate laundry, double garage with internal access, 5kW solar panels, gas central heating and air conditioning unit strategically placed with the lounge to keep you comfortable in every season. Your inspection will not disappoint.
Insights: 35 Spectacle Way, Leopold VIC 3224 was last sold in 2011 and 94 other 4 bedroom house in Leopold have recently been sold.

Description:
PERFECT FOR ALL!
This perfect property is in one of Geelong's growth corridors, this meticulously built home is perfect to start your property investment portfolio, first home buyer, couples, downsizer or simply a quality home ready to move in to and take advantage of its position.
Ideal for the commuter within walking distance to the Marshall Train Station, supermarket and Primary School, 10 minutes into Geelong's CBD and 15 minutes to the Surf Coast.
Featuring an open plan galley style Kitchen with stainless steel cooktop/oven and plenty of bench space which overlooks the dining, family and living area. Off the dining area you can walk outside to the private concreted courtyard which also provides access to the garage and completing the property is a low maintenance backyard to the rear.
Property Features;
- Low maintenance allotment (350sqm)
- 3 bedrooms all with built ins
- Bathroom & Ensuite
- Remote DLUG with internal access
- Gas ducted heating
- Split system for heating/cooling
Rental return approx. $380 - $390 per week.
*All information about the property has been provided to Hayeswinckle by third parties. Hayeswinckle has not verified the information and does not warrant its accuracy or completeness. Parties should make and rely on their own enquiries in relation to this property.

Description:
Ripe and Ready For You!
Situated in one of Belmonts most sought-after pocket. All the amenities you could look for are located on the doorstep of this beautiful home. Offering low maintenance and fuss-free living environment which has been stylishly renovated throughout. Ready for a new owner to walk in and call this home.
Consisting of three generous sized bedrooms, large, updated bathroom with freestanding bath, as well as a separate toilet. The open plan, light-filled kitchen, dining and lounge area offer an abundance of space and flows onto the beautiful decked alfresco area. A perfect space to enjoy on those warm summer nights.
Added features include gas ducted heating, split system A/C, dishwasher, garden shed for extra storage, and major updates including re-stumping, re-roofing and re-wiring.
Superbly located to offer a convenient lifestyle, that will leave you wanting nothing more. You will find yourself only moments from High Street shopping precinct, Waurn Ponds Shopping Centre, Epworth Hospital and Deakin University, plus easy access to the Geelong Ring Road.
Do not miss out on calling this place home! An inspection is a must.
Insights: 1/35 Digby Avenue, Belmont VIC 3216 was last sold in 2020 and 182 other 3 bedroom house in Belmont have recently been sold.

Description:
Renovate, Rent, extend or Develop in sought after Belmont
Here is an amazing opportunity to Renovate, Rent, extend or Develop (STCA) in one of Geelong's most sought after growth suburbs. This charming 3-bedroom, 1 bath, DLUG home set on approx 700m2 in a quiet court would suit an array of buyers from a growing family to savvy investor looking for the perfect addition to their portfolio with potential rent of $350 per week.
Comprising of a neat entry and hardwood floors throughout, you will find three good sized bedrooms down the hall, all with Built in storage. The Spacious open plan living area is equipped with led downlights and split system heating and cooling for year-round comfort. There is also additional room for dining (seating 4-6) or a home study area. Large windows allow in an abundance of natural light. The kitchen features Electrolux electric cooktop and St George oven and great cupboard space. The large central bathroom features a good-sized bath and corner shower all conveniently located next to the separate toilet. Boasting side access and huge double lock up garage, large grassy green backyard, this property is a blank canvas with great potential for renovation or development (STCA).
Conveniently located in a lovely quiet court location, with the open parkland and the reserve of Waurn Ponds creek nearly on your doorstep at the end of the court. Just a short stroll to the Waurn Ponds Shopping Complex, Leisure Link Aquatic Centre/Gym, minutes' drive to Deakin University, access to the ring road and Surf Coast Highway this opportunity is not to be missed.
-700m2
-Split System heating and cooling
-Rent $350 per week
-Split system Heating and cooling
-Quiet court location close to amenities

Description:
An Original Family Home in an Amazing Location!
Set on a 658m2 block this quality family home was built in 1945 by a builder for his own family and had only one owner since then. The property has stood the test of time and offers plenty for the first home buyer, renovator or savvy investor. Tucked in a quiet location that is only a quick stroll to ever-popular Highton Village and moments away from the ever-growing Waurn Ponds shopping precinct, Deakin University, Epworth Hospital, and Geelong Ring Road. This property is also close to quality schools, Highton reserve, and the picturesque Barwon River walking track. Public transport is a stone's throw away on South Valley Road.
The home offers plenty of charm and character with all the rooms offering a generous amount of space. The high ceilings greet you when you first enter and continue throughout the entire home, the north-facing lounge has a gas heater and two of the three bedrooms come with B.I.R that have mirrored doors. The kitchen offers plenty of storage in the below and overhead cupboards and includes a Westinghouse 4 burner stovetop/oven with a large kitchen bench that wraps around the outside wall. The rest of the home includes a dining area, laundry, and a single bathroom with both a bath and shower.
The backyard has ample space to move around and entertain while under the house you will find a double car garage that has plenty of space for the two cars and a workbench. Further through the back garage, you have plenty of options for storage under the house itself and this space can also be accessed by a door leading out to the backyard.
This is a great opportunity to secure an excellent property in a fantastic location. Number 5 Nelson Avenue will be sold via public auction on 6/6/2020 whereby a 10% deposit is required with a 30/60/90 day settlement.
Insights: 5 Nelson Avenue, Highton VIC 3216 was last sold in 2020 and 138 other 3 bedroom house in Highton have recently been sold.

Description:
The perfect first home.
Situated in a family friendly pocket of Leopold, this home has a lot to offer and is sure to tick the boxes for first homeowners, young families and investors.
Behind the bold façade, this home offers 3 spacious bedrooms, a large study or 4th bedroom, 2 living zones, and a secure back yard perfect for those with pets or young children.
The large entry leads down the hallway to the light filled and open plan kitchen, living and dining area. The kitchen offers a large gas cook top, electric oven, dishwasher and plentiful storage.
Accommodation is well-appointed by way of a master bedroom with walk in robe and ensuite, as well as 2 bedrooms to the rear of the home, both with built in robes. The study offers ample space to be utilised as a 4th bedroom.
Features include: Gas central heating, split system air conditioning and a double remote garage with internal access.
Located only a 2 minute drive to the Gateway Plaza, 15 minutes to the Geelong CBD, 15 Minutes to the Bellarine Peninsular and 15 Minutes to Ocean Grove's pristine beaches; this property is central, practical and represents great value in today's market.
Insights: 18 Grassland Grove, Leopold VIC 3224 was last sold in 2020 and 101 other 3 bedroom house in Leopold have recently been sold.

Description:
The perfect first home, investment or renovator.
Situated on 762m2 in a quiet pocket of Blue-chip Marshall, this family home is sure to appeal to the savvy buyer, whom is on the hunt for space, privacy and convenience.
Comprising 3 Spacious bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, 2 living areas, and a practical corner block which offers a large in-ground swimming pool. With fresh paint and new carpet throughout, all you need to do is move in.
On entry, an expansive L-shaped living area is a flexible space that is ideal for a living and dining room. The open plan kitchen overlooks the backyard and second living area - perfect for entertaining guests and keeping an eye on the kids in the back yard.
The main bedroom offers a walk in robe which flows through to the ensuite with vanity and shower. Bedrooms 2 and 3 both offer built in robes and are serviced by a central bathroom with separate toilet. Adjacent to the bathroom, the laundry offers built in storage and provides direct access to the backyard.
Heating is taken care of by a gas wall heater in the kitchen area, and cooling is a breeze with a wall A/C in the main living/dining room.
Outside, the backyard is private and secure for those with pets, and offers an undercover entertaining area, a large in-ground swimming pool, rainwater tank to service garden and pool, shedding for one car plus workshop and a double carport with space in the driveway for 2 more cars.
Situated with great convenience, this property will land you within a short stroll to Marshall Train Station and Marshall Reserve, while being only 10 minutes walk down the road to the local IGA supermarket. Jump in the car and you're only 5-10 minutes from Waurn Ponds shopping centre, Deakin University, the Epworth Hospital, Geelong CBD, and the Geelong ring road. Enquire today, and don't miss this opportunity.
Insights: 26 Grove Road, Marshall VIC 3216 was last sold in 2020 and 28 other 3 bedroom house in Marshall have recently been sold.

Description:
Coastal Delight in Zeally Sands
With an impressive, functional floorplan & contemporary design aesthetics, this home offers the ideal base for modern family living. Located in the popular Zeally Sands Estate, this 4BR home includes a private master retreat with walk in robe, spacious en-suite & separate toilet. Boasting 2 living spaces & perfectly positioned for an abundance of natural light with north-facing open plan living, meals & kitchen, the family can come together to connect, whilst enjoying the privacy of zoned sleeping quarters.
The central family bathroom echoes the same quality features & floor to ceiling tiles as the en suite, with the addition of a bath & separate toilet in the west wing. Soothing, neutral interior tones meet rich merbau decking & graphite coloured brickwork, lawn & beautiful landscaping that will grow to offer screening & privacy. Effortless connection to the outdoors is achieved with double sliding doors to the extended covered north alfresco area for year-round entertaining. An additional living space offers options for a rumpus room, theatre room or even a home office, while other features include ducted heating, high ceilings, soft close cabinetry, enviable storage, study nook, wideboard timber laminate floors, plush carpets, remote controlled DLUG, s/s 900mm oven & gas cooktop, plus a generously proportioned walk-in pantry. Epitomising coastal family living, this home is situated on a 532sqm allotment (approx.) in close proximity to Surf Coast Secondary College, Torquay Coast Primary School, Lisieux Catholic Primary School, Childcare Centre, Dunes shopping complex, skate park, local sporting reserves, plus only minutes to Whites Beach & The Sands Golf Course.
Insights: 31 Pintail Drive, Torquay VIC 3228 was last sold in 2020 and 139 other 4 bedroom house in Torquay have recently been sold.

Description:
Homeschooling haven!
Whether youre homeschooling, working from home or god forbid - both - wouldnt you rather do it somewhere that provides plenty of space for all, and a great yard to boot the kids out to when you need a sanity break!?
The hero of this property is without a doubt the huge flat backyard, pool and spa, great entertaining spaces (ok, maybe not for a little while!) and ridiculous amount of storage space. Theres even side gate access so you can tuck the van or boat away, and another car space up next to the oversized double garage. Absolutely perfect for anyone with a trade related business.
Your master suite is cleverly positioned on the main level, well clear of the kids zone downstairs. The open plan kitchen/dining/living is just sensational, with multiple bifold doors spreading out onto the large deck. Overlooking the pool and backyard, youll also come to enjoy the beautiful sunsets from this magnificent westerly aspect.
A separate study will assist with the working from home setup and keep books and computers off the dining table - well, thats the idea anyway!
Ready now for you to move in and enjoy, call David to organise your private inspection.
Insights: 59 Stoneleigh Crescent, Highton VIC 3216 was last sold in 2020 and 108 other 4 bedroom house in Highton have recently been sold.

Description:
A Private Oasis On Approx. 1819m2!
Occupying approx. 1819m2, this one-owner Malishev property promises sensational family living both inside and out! Showcasing a superb outdoor entertaining zone, expansive backyard with manicured gardens, and ample secure parking, this private oasis is simply divine!
Set in a tranquil court, this location feels worlds away while still being close to all of lifes conveniences. Commuters will appreciate that both Waurn Ponds Train Station and Ring Road access are within close reach. Public transport is a short stroll away, while a quick drive will find you at schools and the Waurn Ponds Shopping Centre. A variety of nearby wineries are yours to enjoy whenever you please, while easy access to Deakin Uni (Waurn Ponds) and Epworth Hospital is the icing on the cake.
The interiors exude timeless elegance, with quality fittings featured throughout. The formal lounge and dining room provide a peaceful retreat, while the open plan living zone is awash in natural light. The kitchen will delight with a large island bench, walk-in pantry, ASKO dishwasher, and stainless steel cooking appliances (double wall oven, gas cooktop, rangehood). Entertainers will be in their element when they lay eyes on the spacious outdoor entertaining zone, which features a pitched ceiling and plantation shutters that filter the western sunlight. Flowing onto the north-facing backyard, this private outdoor retreat is perfect for casual barbeques with loved ones or lively gatherings that linger long into the night.
Zoned to the front of the home, the Master Bedroom is graced with a walk-in robe and en suite. Three additional bedrooms (two with walk-in robes, one with built-in robes) are wonderfully generous. The study (or 5th bedroom), bathroom, powder room, and laundry with ample storage complete the layout. Modcons include zoned ducted heating, two split-system air conditioners, ceiling fans, alarm system, ducted vacuum, and built-in sound system (with individual volume controls). Enchanting gardens line the sprawling lawn areas, while a rainwater tank and veggie gardens promote sustainable living. The remote triple lock-up garage features internal access and backyard vehicle access, while the tall roller doors are ideal for storing boats or trailers. Secure, undercover caravan storage is the final feature of this exceptional property. Enquire today to secure this idyllic family lifestyle!
Insights: 2-3 Champagne Court, Waurn Ponds VIC 3216 was last sold in 2020 and 25 other 4 bedroom house in Waurn Ponds have recently been sold.

Description:
Buy One or Buy Both
A rare and wonderful opportunity presents itself to acquire an iconic riverfront property, one of the select few in Barwon Heads that can claim absolute water frontage. Holding a commanding position in a very tightly held strip, this exceptional property is all about lifestyle and position. Celebrating the captivating beauty of the Barwon River, this family property is set upon a large allotment with the beach house and garden block on separate titles with further potential for future subdivision (STCA). This in turn presents three exciting options to choose from:
Option 1:
Purchase the 6 bedroom, 2 bathroom and 2 living areas double-storey home on 620m² (approx.) land with absolute river frontage. You will never tire of the glorious views of the river with its myriad of birdlife and watercraft. You can even launch your boat from your private boat ramp and enjoy the ever-changing vista of the river. Set up for the large family you can enjoy holidays, weekends or extended stays. Alternatively, renovate or rebuild (STCA) and make it your dream family home.
Option 2:
Purchase the 630m² (approx.) vacant parcel of land. You can put plans and permits in place to build your dream home or with possible future subdivision look to develop (STCA).
Option 3:
Purchase the home and vacant parcel of land. You can then enjoy the 1250m² (approx.) parcel of land and house as-is and make many happy memories for the whole family for many years to come.
Whichever way you decide to go this is a once in a lifetime opportunity to purchase in a highly sought after, quiet location in the beautiful seaside village of Barwon Heads. Dont let this one pass you by.
Insights: 26-28 Riverside Terrace, Barwon Heads VIC 3227 was last sold in 2020.

Description:
Edwardian Elegance
A timeless illustration of distinctive beauty and exceptional lifestyle allure, this picture perfect four bedroom Edwardian effortlessly blends elegant period charm with all the contemporary comforts. Under captivating soaring ceilings, this home welcomes you to an era of luxury with generous sized bedrooms, timber flooring and indulgent bathrooms.
The master suite offers walk in robe and extensive ensuite with duel vanity and oversized shower. The remaining bedrooms are filled with natural light and a versatile forth bedroom also works as a formal lounge or home office with fireplace. The main bathroom features a sophisticated claw foot tub.
Cathedral ceilings and an abundance of natural northern light, highlight the space dedicated to family and entertaining. A well-appointed kitchen includes walk in pantry and ample preparation space. A well planned rear yard offers multiple entertaining opportunities taking into account all the seasons. Established gardens offer a spring and summer filled with colour and fragrance.
With the modern luxuries of central heating, split-system cooling, Solar panels and side access with double garage, this period home takes advantage of an exceptional family-friendly neighbourhood within striking distance to the Barwon River.
Insights: 14-15 Affleck Court, Barwon Heads VIC 3227 was last sold in 2020 and 35 other 4 bedroom house in Barwon Heads have recently been sold.

Description:
Views Views & More Views
Sometimes some locations Brag it all. Views, size and location, are all things sorted when you purchase lot 62 in Grossmans Ridge.
Perched high in the estate and backing on to farm zone you will appreciate the northern rear and spectacular outlooks over Mount Duneed and Freshwater Creek.
The sizeable 4000sqm allotment is flat and offers all services such as sewer, electricity, gas, water & NBN
Who said you can't have it all?
